summary.p: 13 fol.; Writing surface: parchment; Shelfmark: R. 17; Text: ?; Various number of lines per page; Dimensions: 156 x 235 mm; Script style: various styles of kūfī; Estimated date of production: 2nd (8th) to 4th (10th) centuries [according to Karatay].
This entry is based on the catalogue of Fehmi E. Karatay (1888-1968). Currently we do not have access to the images.

Karatay (1962) describes the manuscripts as follows, p. 7: "21 R. 17 Kur’an’dan Parçalar Parşömen. 235mm boy ve 156mm eninde 13 yaprak. Sahifede değişik kûfî yazılarla değişik sayıda satır. Bu cilt muhtelif Kur’an parçalarından toplanmıştır. İçinde II., III. ve VI. asırlara ait Kur’an yaprakları vardır; bazıları kâğıtla tamir edilmiştir. Miklepli siyah deri cilt."

This can be translated as follows: "21 R. 17 Fragments of the Qurʾān Parchment. 13 leaves of 235 mm height and 156 mm width. The text area, written in various Kufic script styles [contains] various number of lines. This fragment has been collected from various parts of Qurʾān. It includes the leaves of the Qurʾān from the second, third and fourth centuries; some of them are repaired with paper. Black leather binding with flap (miklep)."
